pullRequest.body:
If a functor `F : C ⥤ D` between pretriangulated categories is triangulated, and if we
have an adjunction `F ⊣ G`, then `G` is also a triangulated functor.

We deduce that, if `E : C ≌ D` is an equivalence of pretriangulated categories, then
`E.functor` is triangulated if and only if `E.inverse` is triangulated.

TODO: The case of left adjoints.

- [x] depends on: #20083 [the adjoint of an additive functor is additive]
- [ ] depends on: #20337

---

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [891a072f05](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20255/commits/891a072f0533d384aed2f54139c69c2d8143b74f)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Triangulated.Adjunction` (new file)|1105|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ commShift_counit`
`+ commShift_counit_app`
`+ commShift_unit`
`+ commShift_unit_app`
`+ comp`
`+ id`
`+ instComp`
`+ instId`
`+ instance : (E.trans E').CommShift A := by`
`+ instance : (E.trans E').functor.CommShift A := by`
`+ instance : (E.trans E').inverse.CommShift A := by`
`+ instance : (Equivalence.refl (C := C)).CommShift A := by`
`+ instance : (Equivalence.refl (C := C)).functor.CommShift A := by`
`+ instance : (Equivalence.refl (C := C)).inverse.CommShift A := by`
`+ instance [E.IsTriangulated] : E.functor.IsTriangulated := inferInstance`
`+ instance [E.IsTriangulated] : E.inverse.IsTriangulated := inferInstance`
`+ instance [h : E.functor.IsTriangulated] : E.symm.inverse.IsTriangulated := h`
`+ instance [h : E.inverse.IsTriangulated] : E.symm.functor.IsTriangulated := h`
`+ isTriangulated_rightAdjoint`
`+ mk''`
`+ refl`
`+ refl_toAdjunction`
`+ symm`
`+ trans`
`++ IsTriangulated`
`++ mk'`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#20083~~
* leanprover-community/mathlib4#20337
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (🤖). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
It would be nice to remove this `erw`.
I removed it in the stupidest possible way.
Could you add an instance `symm` saying that if the equivalence `E` is triangulated, then so is `E.symm`?

```suggestion
    obtain ⟨Z, f, g, mem⟩ := distinguished_cocone_triangle (G.map T.mor₁)
    obtain ⟨h, ⟨h₁, h₂⟩⟩ := complete_distinguished_triangle_morphism _ _
      (F.map_distinguished _ mem) hT (adj.counit.app T.obj₁) (adj.counit.app T.obj₂) (by simp)
    dsimp at h h₁ h₂ ⊢
```

```suggestion
      have eq := DFunLike.congr_arg (adj.homEquiv _ _ ) hα
      simp only [homEquiv_counit, Functor.id_obj, homEquiv_unit, comp_id,
        Functor.map_comp, unit_naturality_assoc, right_triangle_components] at eq
      have eq' := comp_distTriang_mor_zero₁₂ _ mem
      dsimp at eq eq'
      rw [eq, assoc, assoc, eq', comp_zero, comp_zero]
```

```suggestion
        obtain ⟨α, hα⟩ : ∃ α, α = φ - ψ ≫ adj.homEquiv _ _ h := ⟨_, rfl⟩
```

```suggestion
        suffices ∃ (β : Y ⟶ Z), β ≫ adj.homEquiv _ _ h = α by
```

Actually, we should first define `Adjunction.IsTriangulated`:
```lean
class IsTriangulated : Prop where
  commShift : adj.CommShift ℤ := by infer_instance
  leftAdjoint_isTriangulated : F.IsTriangulated := by infer_instance
  rightAdjoint_isTriangulated : G.IsTriangulated := by infer_instance
```
Then, the corresponding definition for equivalences can be defined as an `abbrev` similarly as for `CommShift`.
Finally, you may also include instances for the identity adjunction, and the composition of adjunctions (and similarly for `Equivalence.refl` and `Equivalence.trans`).

A constructor for this class should also be provided, saying that it suffices to prove that the left adjoint is triangulated. (The symmetric constructor should also be provided, of course, but the second will have to wait.)

The `Adjunction.IsTriangulated` instances for the identity and the composition first require similar instances for `Adjunction.CommShift`: #20337

pullRequest.title: feat(CategoryTheory/Triangulated/Adjunction): the right adjoint of a triangulated functor is triangulated
